subject: chemistry
hook: Fluorine is the GREEDIEST element... it STEALS electrons from EVERYONE!
key_points: Electronegativity = How badly an atom WANTS electrons
Fluorine is #1 (4.0) - the ultimate electron thief
Francium is last (0.7) - gives away electrons like free candy
Higher electronegativity difference = more polar bond
Pauling scale: Named after Linus Pauling (2x Nobel winner!)
core_analogy: Electronegativity is like a tug-of-war for electrons. Fluorine is the UNDEFEATED champion - no one can beat it!
mind_blow: When Fluorine meets Cesium, the electronegativity difference is so high (3.3) that Cesium basically DONATES its electron!
exam_relevance: JEE loves: Predict bond polarity using electronegativity. NEET asks: Why HF is a weak acid despite F being most electronegative.
